result.execSummary:
The defendant William B. Thornton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William B. Thornton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William B. Thornton was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • William B. Thornton was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 200 days served if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.   
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with any children under age of 12 until completion of parenting class & anger management class, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVOKED  -  Both counts concurrent with each other and consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action. 
 May not have contact with any children under 12 years of age unless completion of parenting class & consent of agent, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

supervisions.notes: **Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected during extended supervision
PROBATION REVOKED  -  Both counts concurrent with each other and consecutive to any other sentence.
** Any upaid court obligations are still to be collected during extended supervision

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge

State appears by Special Prosecutor Thaddeus McGuire.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Moore and with ASL interpreter Mala Boyce, who is sworn in.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Attorney Moore indicates that she has reviewed the revocation packet and PSI with the defendant.  Sentencing arguments heard.  On counts 1 and 3 the court imposes a sentence of 42 months WSP; 18 months initial confinement and 24 months extended supervision with conditions.  There are 200 days credit for time served.  Both counts concurrent with each other and consecutive to any other sentence.  The defendant may not have contact with any children under the age of 12 unless he successfully completes a parenting class and with the consent of the agent.  The DE is eligible for CIP, but not eligible for SAP.  Costs remaining to be paid during extended supervision.
With the DA's office, Attorney Moore, and the interpreter, sentencing after revocation set for 11/10/17 @ 8:20.
DA's request for adjournment of the sentencing after revocation on 11/10/17 is granted by Judge Kerkman; clerk to reschedule

Sentencing after revocation set for today will be adjourned; Attorney Moore needs additional time to review the documents with the DE and the interpreter; with Attorney Moore and the interpreter, SEHR adjourned to 11/10/17 @ 1:30

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Joseph Easton and assisted by ASL interpreter Mala Boyce.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 2 and 4 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 1 and 3 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  PSI that was filed in 13-CF-169 referred to by the Court.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  Credit for 200 days served if probation is revoked.  Cash bond in 13-CF-169 to apply to costs due.

Defendant William B. Thornton appeared with Attorney Joseph G. Easton. Interpreter Mala Boyce in court for DE.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Interpreter sworn in. Atty Easton states matter is nearly resolved, requests a brief adjournment; granted by The Court. Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
